reviewText: Apparently, there are a lot of people that don't like the horror-comedy Munchies, what with it only having a 3.3 on imdb.com. And I just don't understand why. I think it's funnier than both Gremlins and Critters, with campy and over-the-top performances by Harvey Korman and Alix Elias. If you ever get the munchies for a dumb but fun horror-comedy, then this flick should do the trick!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film is a pure guilty pleasure of mine.  When I was a kid I loved this movie.  One day I was browsing a movie store and found this lost gem for 7 bucks.  Needless to say I snatch that little beggar up.  Heck I would have spent 15 dollars to recapture a little of my childhood.  Amazingly enough I still laughed at some of same parts I did when I was a kid.  The characters are just way over the top and very cartoon like, especially Dude, the deadhead.  This movie like many of its genre shows everything bad about the 80s, which is one thing I enjoy about films such as these.This film came out during the same decade that brought us other movies with little killer monsters such as Gremlins, Ghoulies I and II, Puppet Master, and Critters I and II.  Granted, Munchies are much tamer movie than those other films, but it has to be the funniest out of the bunch.  If you weren't a kid during the 80s you might ask yourself why the heck do some people like this film?  Well I guess you just had to be there.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Its shameful that these sellers are selling the DVD for 50 bucks(that's the least amount).DON'T BUY IT FOR THAT PRICE.  As much as i love this movie, its worth 30 bucks the most if you're a fan.  If not, or if you never saw it, its worth between 2-5 bucks and no more.I love this movie.  i use to watch it dozens of times as a kid.  Its not a well made movie.  If it wasn't for nostalghia, it might not have an audience.I still own this on VHS and would gladly buy the DVD.  But I'm not a sucker and no one should pay these prices for it.  It's disgusting.

reviewText: I remembered this movie from when I was in High School.. and watching... yes I admit it... it was a corny off beat comedy.. but then again what 80s comedy was not like that... thats what made them so good.. they just don't make them like they used to... but most of the public have turned into a bunch of politically correct amoebas..who are "harmed or offended" by today videos games, something that was said in a movie, etc..  Many of the people today who give these movies bad reviews were not even a twinkle in their pops eyes around during the time of the original release!! There were alot of good movies during the 80s that have been long sense overlooked and forgotten such as:  Up the Creek, Up the Academy, Runaway, Mr Mom, etc... all these were movies I watched and loved during my life as a teenager...

reviewText: You can tell that this movie would find itself at home on the Syfy channel as it is a lower grade movie with actors and acting.  HOWEVER, this movie holds it's own by drawing you in with it's interesting yet corny story.  Somehow a tiny living alien nicknamed a "Munchie" is discovered in an Incan tomb and brought back to the United States to prove the existence of alien influence on Incan architecture and culture.  Apparently this "Munchie" is a very quick learner and picks up speaking other languages very well on top of developing a very perverted personality when exposed to his very first playboy!  I don't want to spoil the movie but like the Gremlins, the Munchies can replicate by cutting them in half and unlike the Gremlins, the Munchies can not be killed!  You will have to watch this movie to see how this hysterical story develops and concludes!  I watched this movie as a child and only NOW do I understand some of the things that I was oblivious to back then!  It is my own personal cult classic!
summary: The Gremlins have NOTHING on the Munchies!

reviewText: After Gremlins, other studios went berserk to capitalize on the "little mischievous monsters" fad, and soon after followed films like CRITTERS, GHOULIES and of course, MUNCHIES. This movie is fun and silly, and very cheaply made. The creatures look ridiculous and fake, but as the movie doesn't take itself too seriously, this just adds to the charm. Horny little monsters with the munchies... Cool! The added trait that if you chop them up into little pieces, the pieces will multiply into new Munchies is another twist on Gremlins-style lore, but unique and cool in its own way. Overall it's not great, not particularly funny... A good starter horror movie for young kids (who somehow aren't too jaded by video games and CGI...)
Title: N/A
